User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the WattsUp Electrical Toolkit application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

registrationDate.description: Date and time the user registered.

lastLogin.description: Date and time of the user's last login.

definition.description: Stores user profile information.  Accessible only to the authenticated user (request.auth.uid == userId).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, matching the Firebase Authentication UID.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the WattsUp Electrical Toolkit application, focusing on user authentication and data isolation.  The core principle is Authorization Independence, achieved through path-based ownership.  Each user's data is stored under their unique user ID, eliminating the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules and ensuring atomic operations are possible.

The `/users/{userId}` collection stores user profile information. This path structure ensures that only the authenticated user (identified by `request.auth.uid`) can access their own data, providing a solid foundation for data privacy.

The structure inherently supports QAPs (Rules are not Filters) because each user's data is isolated under their `userId`. List operations are secure as rules can simply verify that `request.auth.uid == userId`.

Authentication providers are 'password' and 'anonymous', requiring secure handling on the client-side using Firebase Authentication.
